intro: Cissampelos boivinii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in suitable climates.
